title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Leviticus chapter 20 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Leviticus Chapter 20.

questions.question: Who did the LORD speak to in Leviticus 20?
questions.correctAnswer: Moses
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:1 states that the LORD spake unto Moses.

questions.question: What punishment is given to anyone who gives their seed to Molech?
options: They shall be put to death
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be put to death
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:2 says that whoever gives any of his seed to Molech shall surely be put to death.

questions.question: What will happen to a man who curses his father or mother?
options: He shall be put to death
He shall be punished with lashes
questions.correctAnswer: He shall be put to death
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:9 clearly states that everyone who curses his father or mother shall be surely put to death.

questions.question: What is the penalty for a man who commits adultery with his neighbor's wife?
options: They shall be put to death
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be put to death
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:10 states that both the adulterer and the adulteress shall surely be put to death.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 20, what must the people of Israel do to be holy?
questions.correctAnswer: Sanctify themselves
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:7 commands the people to sanctify themselves and be holy because the LORD is holy.

questions.question: What is the punishment for a man who lies with his daughter-in-law?
options: They shall be put to death
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be put to death
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:12 says both the man and his daughter-in-law shall surely be put to death for lying together.

questions.question: What happens to a man who lies with a male as he lies with a woman?
options: They have committed an abomination and shall be put to death
questions.correctAnswer: They have committed an abomination and shall be put to death
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:13 states that both have committed an abomination and shall surely be put to death.

questions.question: What is the punishment for taking a wife and her mother together?
options: They shall be burnt with fire
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be burnt with fire
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:14 says both he and the women shall be burnt with fire for such wickedness.

questions.question: What does Leviticus 20:15 say about a man lying with a beast?
options: He shall be put to death and the beast killed
questions.correctAnswer: He shall be put to death and the beast killed
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:15 states the man shall surely be put to death and the beast shall be slain.

questions.question: If a woman lies with a beast, what does the law say should happen?
options: Both the woman and the beast shall be put to death
Only the woman shall be punished
Only the beast shall be killed
questions.correctAnswer: Both the woman and the beast shall be put to death
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:16 commands that both the woman and the beast shall surely be put to death.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 20:26 says the LORD has severed Israel from other people so they should be holy unto Him.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:26 states that the LORD is holy and has severed Israel from other people so they should be holy.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 20 forbids seeking out familiar spirits and wizards, with death as the penalty.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:6 and 20:27 both say those who seek familiar spirits or are wizards shall be put to death.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 20:23 encourages the people of Israel to walk in the manners of the nations before them.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:23 forbids walking in the manners of the nations because God abhors their practices.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Leviticus 20:8: 'And ye shall keep my statutes, and do them: I am the LORD which ______ you.'
questions.correctAnswer: sanctify you
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:8 says, 'I am the LORD which sanctify you.'

questions.question: Complete the following from Leviticus 20:24: 'I am the LORD your God, which have separated you from other ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: people
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:24 says God has separated Israel from other people.

medium.title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Leviticus Chapter 20 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with resisting temptation in marriage. Based on Leviticus 20, what biblical truth would you share about faithfulness?
options: Adultery is a serious sin that leads to death as a consequence
It is acceptable to marry multiple wives
Adultery is tolerated if it is kept secret
God does not concern Himself with marital sins
questions.correctAnswer: Adultery is a serious sin that leads to death as a consequence
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:10 states that the adulterer and adulteress shall surely be put to death, emphasizing the seriousness of faithfulness in marriage. This underscores the importance of obedience and holiness in personal relationships.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 20 teach us about integrity in honoring parents?
options: Cursing one’s father or mother results in death
Parents should be ignored if they are harsh
Respect is optional in difficult family situations
Only children of Israel must honor their parents
questions.correctAnswer: Cursing one’s father or mother results in death
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:9 declares that anyone who curses their father or mother shall be put to death, highlighting the importance of respect and integrity in family life as an expression of obedience to God.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to engage in occult practices. What warning does Leviticus 20 give about such actions?
options: Those who consult familiar spirits or wizards will be cut off from their people
Occult practices are a way to gain wisdom
Occult practices are permitted during times of distress
questions.correctAnswer: Those who consult familiar spirits or wizards will be cut off from their people
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:6 and Leviticus 20:27 clearly state that those who turn to familiar spirits or wizards shall be put to death and cut off, emphasizing the call to holiness and separation from such practices.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 20, what should believers do to maintain holiness before God?
options: Sanctify yourselves and keep God’s statutes
Follow the customs of the nations around them
Ignore God’s laws in favor of personal desires
questions.correctAnswer: Sanctify yourselves and keep God’s statutes
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:7-8 instructs believers to sanctify themselves, be holy, and keep God’s statutes, highlighting the importance of obedience and personal devotion in living a holy life.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 20 guide believers regarding family purity and sexual ethics?
options: Sexual relations with close relatives are forbidden and punishable by death
Sexual ethics are flexible depending on circumstances
questions.correctAnswer: Sexual relations with close relatives are forbidden and punishable by death
questions.explanation: Verses such as Leviticus 20:11-12, 17-21 clearly forbid sexual relations with relatives like a father’s wife, daughter-in-law, or sister and prescribe death for such offenses, emphasizing purity and holiness in family life.

questions.question: A believer is unsure about how to respond to temptation. What does Leviticus 20 teach about consequences for certain sins?
options: Some sins, including idolatry and sexual immorality, have severe consequences including death
Sin has no real consequences in this life
Only minor punishments are given for serious sins
God overlooks sins if one repents later
questions.correctAnswer: Some sins, including idolatry and sexual immorality, have severe consequences including death
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20 discusses death as the penalty for giving children to Molech (vv. 2-5) and various sexual sins (vv. 10-16), showing the seriousness of sin and the need for obedience and perseverance in holiness.

questions.question: True or False: According to Leviticus 20, believers are called to separate themselves from the practices of surrounding nations to maintain holiness.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:23 commands the Israelites not to follow the manners of the nations God has cast out, emphasizing separation to preserve holiness and obedience.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 20 encourages believers to be holy because God is holy and has set them apart for Himself.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:26 states that God has severed His people from others so that they should be holy to Him, reflecting the call to imitate God's holiness in daily living.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Leviticus 20 teaches that the land will  you if you do not keep God's statutes and judgments.
questions.correctAnswer: spue
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:22 warns that the land will 'spue you out' if the people do not keep God's statutes, teaching the practical consequence of obedience in stewardship of the land God gives.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 20 instruct believers to treat unclean animals in relation to their holiness?
options: Separate clean from unclean animals and avoid making themselves abominable
questions.correctAnswer: Separate clean from unclean animals and avoid making themselves abominable
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:25 commands distinguishing between clean and unclean animals to avoid defiling oneself, illustrating obedience and holiness in daily discipline and stewardship.

questions.question: A believer is seeking counsel on how to live a holy life. What does Leviticus 20 emphasize about God's role in sanctification?
options: The LORD sanctifies His people and calls them to obey His statutes
Sanctification is purely human effort without God's help
God does not require holiness from His people
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD sanctifies His people and calls them to obey His statutes
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:8 states 'I am the LORD which sanctify you,' teaching that God is the source of holiness and calls believers to obey His commandments.

questions.question: Based on Leviticus 20, what is the biblical approach to dealing with sin in the community?
options: Sin must be addressed seriously, sometimes by removing the sinner from the community
Sin should be ignored to maintain peace
Only God concerns Himself with sin, not the community
Sins are private and should not affect community relations
questions.correctAnswer: Sin must be addressed seriously, sometimes by removing the sinner from the community
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:3-5 shows God’s judgment against those who defile the community, calling for accountability and holiness to preserve the sanctity of the people.

questions.question: What practical lesson about obedience and consequences can be learned from the punishment for offering children to Molech in Leviticus 20?
options: God demands obedience and will judge severely those who profane His name
Offering children to Molech is a minor offense
Consequences for sin are symbolic only
questions.correctAnswer: God demands obedience and will judge severely those who profane His name
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:2-3 shows that giving children to Molech results in death and God cutting off the offender, teaching the seriousness of obedience and reverence for God's holiness.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 20 guide believers in the virtue of humility and contentment in family relationships?
options: Believers are to avoid relationships that cause confusion and disgrace, like marrying close relatives
Believers should seek to increase family status by any means
Family relationships are unimportant to God
questions.correctAnswer: Believers are to avoid relationships that cause confusion and disgrace, like marrying close relatives
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:12, 17 teach that sexual relations with close family members cause confusion and disgrace, emphasizing humility and contentment in proper family roles.

questions.question: What biblical truth about stewardship and holiness can be learned from Leviticus 20's instructions on clean and unclean animals?
options: Believers must distinguish between clean and unclean to avoid defiling their souls
All animals are equally acceptable for food
Only priests must observe dietary laws
questions.correctAnswer: Believers must distinguish between clean and unclean to avoid defiling their souls
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:25 teaches the importance of separating clean from unclean animals to maintain holiness and avoid defiling oneself, reflecting discipline in stewardship and obedience.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with forgiveness and reconciliation in their family. How does Leviticus 20 show the seriousness of sin and the call to holiness in relationships?
options: Sin in family relationships has serious consequences and calls believers to holiness and obedience
Family sins are less important to God
Reconciliation is optional in God's eyes
questions.correctAnswer: Sin in family relationships has serious consequences and calls believers to holiness and obedience
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:9-21 outlines serious consequences for sins like cursing parents or sexual immorality, underscoring the call to holiness in family life and the need for reconciliation grounded in obedience.

hard.title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Leviticus Chapter 20.

questions.question: What is the prescribed punishment for anyone who gives their seed to Molech according to Leviticus 20?
options: They shall be put to death and stoned by the people of the land
They shall be exiled from Israel
They shall be fined and publicly shamed
They shall be imprisoned for life
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be put to death and stoned by the people of the land
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:2 states that anyone who gives their seed to Molech shall surely be put to death, and the people of the land shall stone him with stones.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 20, what is the consequence for a man who lies with his father's wife?
options: Both shall surely be put to death
They shall be excommunicated from the community
They shall pay restitution to the family
questions.correctAnswer: Both shall surely be put to death
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:11 specifies that a man who lies with his father's wife has uncovered his father's nakedness and both shall surely be put to death.

questions.question: Which of the following relationships is explicitly condemned in Leviticus 20 with the phrase 'they shall be cut off from among their people'?
options: A man lying with his daughter-in-law
A man lying with a neighboring woman
A man lying with an unrelated woman
A man lying with a woman during her menstrual period
questions.correctAnswer: A man lying with his daughter-in-law
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:12 states that if a man lies with his daughter-in-law, both shall surely be put to death and cut off from among their people.

questions.question: In Leviticus 20, what is the term used to describe the act of a man lying with another man as he lies with a woman?
questions.correctAnswer: An abomination
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:13 calls the act of a man lying with another man as he lies with a woman an abomination, punishable by death.

questions.question: Leviticus 20:9 prescribes death for anyone who curses which family members?
questions.correctAnswer: His father or his mother
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:9 clearly states that anyone who curses his father or mother shall surely be put to death.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'I am the LORD which sanctify you' in Leviticus 20:8 within the covenant context?
options: It emphasizes God's role in making Israel holy and sets the basis for obedience to His statutes
It serves as a warning against foreign idolatry only
It highlights the need for ritual sacrifices exclusively
It indicates a temporary covenant with no lasting effect
questions.correctAnswer: It emphasizes God's role in making Israel holy and sets the basis for obedience to His statutes
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:8 declares that God sanctifies Israel, emphasizing that their holiness and adherence to His laws stem from His initiative, foundational to the covenant relationship.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 20, what is the punishment for a man who lies with a beast?
options: He shall surely be put to death and the beast shall be killed
He shall be exiled from the community
He shall perform a ritual cleansing
questions.correctAnswer: He shall surely be put to death and the beast shall be killed
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:15 commands that if a man lies with a beast, both he and the beast must be put to death.

questions.question: What does Leviticus 20:26 teach about the purpose of Israel's holiness?
options: Israel is holy to God because He is holy and has severed them from other peoples to be His own
Israel is holy to distinguish themselves as wealthy
Israel is holy to gain power over neighboring nations
Israel is holy only through their sacrifices
questions.correctAnswer: Israel is holy to God because He is holy and has severed them from other peoples to be His own
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:26 explains that Israel's holiness is grounded in God's own holiness and the special covenant relationship that sets them apart.

questions.question: Leviticus 20:23 warns Israel not to walk in the manners of which people?
options: The nations which God cast out before Israel
questions.correctAnswer: The nations which God cast out before Israel
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:23 instructs Israel not to adopt the customs of the nations God dispossessed, as their practices led to God's abhorrence.

questions.question: True or False: According to Leviticus 20:27, both men and women who have familiar spirits or are wizards shall be put to death.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:27 clearly states that a man or woman who has a familiar spirit or is a wizard shall surely be put to death.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 20:24 foreshadow the Promised Land described elsewhere in the Bible?
options: It describes the land as flowing with milk and honey, a theme echoed in Exodus and Numbers
It predicts the destruction of the land by foreign nations
It emphasizes the barren nature of the land
It compares the land to Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: It describes the land as flowing with milk and honey, a theme echoed in Exodus and Numbers
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:24 refers to the land flowing with milk and honey, a recurrent biblical theme signifying fertility and God's blessing on the Promised Land.

questions.question: The Hebrew term used in Leviticus 20:13 for 'abomination' (תֹּועֵבָה, to'evah) signifies what in the cultural context of ancient Israel?
options: A detestable act violating divine covenant laws
questions.correctAnswer: A detestable act violating divine covenant laws
questions.explanation: The Hebrew word 'to'evah' used in Leviticus 20:13 denotes something abhorrent to God, especially acts that break covenantal boundaries, reflecting deep cultural and religious taboos.

questions.question: Leviticus 20:6 and 20:27 both mention familiar spirits and wizards. What does this repetition suggest about the author's intent?
options: To strongly emphasize the prohibition and seriousness of necromancy and sorcery
To allow for some flexibility in the law
To highlight their acceptance in certain contexts
questions.correctAnswer: To strongly emphasize the prohibition and seriousness of necromancy and sorcery
questions.explanation: The repeated references to familiar spirits and wizards underscore the author's intent to forbid these practices emphatically, reflecting Israel's need for spiritual purity.

questions.question: What literary structure is evident in Leviticus 20:2-5 regarding the offense of giving seed to Molech and communal responsibility?
options: A chiastic structure emphasizing individual guilt and communal accountability
questions.correctAnswer: A chiastic structure emphasizing individual guilt and communal accountability
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:2-5 forms a chiastic pattern where individual sin (giving seed to Molech) is paralleled by communal failure to act, highlighting both personal and corporate responsibility.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 20:7-8's call to holiness relate to New Testament teachings on sanctification?
options: It anticipates the New Testament call to be holy as God is holy, reflecting continuous divine expectation
It contradicts New Testament teachings on grace
It focuses solely on ritual law with no moral implications
It is irrelevant to Christian theology
questions.correctAnswer: It anticipates the New Testament call to be holy as God is holy, reflecting continuous divine expectation
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:7-8's command to sanctify and be holy parallels 1 Peter 1:16 and other New Testament passages affirming God's unchanging call to holiness.

theological.title: Leviticus Chapter 20 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Leviticus Chapter 20 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 20, what is the consequence for anyone who gives their seed to Molech?
options: They shall surely be put to death
questions.correctAnswer: They shall surely be put to death
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:2 commands that anyone who gives their seed to Molech shall surely be put to death. This severe judgment reflects God’s holiness and intolerance of idolatry (cf. Deut 12:31; 2 Kings 23:10; Jer 32:35; Acts 7:43).

questions.question: What does God declare He will do to a man who consults familiar spirits and wizards?
options: Cut him off from among his people
questions.correctAnswer: Cut him off from among his people
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:6 states that God will set His face against a soul that turns to familiar spirits and wizards and cut him off from his people. This shows God's holiness and rejection of occult practices (cf. Deut 18:10-12; Isa 8:19; Gal 5:19-21; Acts 16:16-18).

questions.question: What is the fundamental reason given for the command to be holy in Leviticus 20?
options: Because the LORD your God is holy
questions.correctAnswer: Because the LORD your God is holy
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:7 commands sanctification and holiness because the LORD your God is holy. This foundational principle reflects God's moral perfection and the call for His people to reflect His character (cf. Lev 11:44-45; 1 Pet 1:15-16; Heb 12:14; 1 Thess 4:7).

questions.question: What is the prescribed punishment for a man who curses his father or mother according to Leviticus 20?
options: He shall be surely put to death
He shall be disciplined by the elders
questions.correctAnswer: He shall be surely put to death
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:9 states that anyone who curses his father or mother shall surely be put to death. This highlights the sacredness of parental authority and the serious consequences of dishonoring them (cf. Exod 21:17; Deut 21:18-21; Matt 15:4; Eph 6:2-3).

questions.question: Leviticus 20 condemns adultery with what specific relationship?
questions.correctAnswer: Another man's wife
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:10 prescribes death for a man who commits adultery with his neighbor’s wife. This emphasizes the sanctity of marriage and faithfulness (cf. Exod 20:14; Prov 6:32; Heb 13:4; Matt 5:27-28).

questions.question: What is the consequence for a man who lies with his father's wife as stated in Leviticus 20?
options: Both shall surely be put to death
They shall be forgiven if they repent
questions.correctAnswer: Both shall surely be put to death
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:11 states that a man who lies with his father’s wife and the woman shall both be put to death, underscoring the gravity of incestuous relations (cf. Lev 18:8; Deut 27:20; 1 Cor 5:1-5; Heb 13:4).

questions.question: Which of the following is described as an 'abomination' in Leviticus 20?
options: A man lying with another man as with a woman
questions.correctAnswer: A man lying with another man as with a woman
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:13 calls same-sex intercourse an abomination deserving death, illustrating God’s design for sexual relations within His covenant order (cf. Lev 18:22; Rom 1:26-27; 1 Cor 6:9-10; Jude 1:7).

questions.question: What is the punishment for a man who marries both a woman and her mother, according to Leviticus 20?
options: They shall be burnt with fire
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be burnt with fire
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:14 prescribes burning with fire for a man who takes a wife and her mother, emphasizing the seriousness of such sexual immorality (cf. Lev 18:17; Deut 22:30; Ezek 22:10; Rev 21:8).

questions.question: According to Leviticus 20, what is the fate of a man who lies with a beast?
options: He shall surely be put to death
He shall be disciplined by elders
questions.correctAnswer: He shall surely be put to death
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:15 states that a man who lies with a beast shall be put to death, demonstrating God’s rejection of bestiality as a defilement of His creation order (cf. Exod 22:19; Deut 27:21; 1 Cor 6:9; Rom 1:26-27).

questions.question: What does Leviticus 20 say about uncovering the nakedness of a close relative such as a sister or uncle's wife?
options: It is a wicked thing and they shall be cut off
It is permitted in certain cases
questions.correctAnswer: It is a wicked thing and they shall be cut off
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:17 and 20 describe uncovering nakedness of close kin as wicked, with the penalty of being cut off or dying childless, highlighting the importance of sexual purity within family boundaries (cf. Lev 18:6-18; Deut 27:22-23; Ezek 22:11; Heb 13:4).

questions.question: What is the theological significance of God stating 'I am the LORD which sanctify you' in Leviticus 20?
options: God is the source of His people's holiness
God only commands holiness but does not enable it
Holiness is optional for God's people
Holiness is achieved by human effort alone
questions.correctAnswer: God is the source of His people's holiness
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:8 teaches that God sanctifies His people, meaning He is the source and enabler of their holiness, reflecting His sovereign grace (cf. Exod 31:13; 1 Cor 1:30; Heb 10:10; 1 Thess 4:7-8).

questions.question: What does Leviticus 20:22-23 reveal about the reason for God's statutes and judgments?
options: To prevent the land from spitting out the people
questions.correctAnswer: To prevent the land from spitting out the people
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:22-23 explains that God’s laws are to keep the land from rejecting His people, indicating the covenantal relationship between obedience and blessing (cf. Lev 18:24-28; Deut 28:15-68; Jer 7:26; Ezek 20:26).

questions.question: Leviticus 20 emphasizes separating clean from unclean animals. What is the spiritual purpose of this distinction?
options: To avoid making their souls abominable
questions.correctAnswer: To avoid making their souls abominable
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:25 commands separating clean from unclean to prevent defiling the soul, pointing to holiness in daily life and obedience (cf. Lev 11:44-45; Deut 14:3-21; Isa 52:11; 1 Pet 1:16).

questions.question: How does Leviticus 20 characterize God’s relationship to His people in verse 26?
options: God has severed them from other peoples to be holy unto Him
God has chosen them to dominate other nations
God has made them wealthy and powerful
God has given them freedom from all laws
questions.correctAnswer: God has severed them from other peoples to be holy unto Him
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:26 states that God set Israel apart from other peoples to be holy, emphasizing election, sanctification, and covenant identity (cf. Exod 19:5-6; Deut 7:6; 1 Pet 2:9; Rom 11:2).

questions.question: What is the prescribed punishment for both a man and woman who are found to have a familiar spirit or be wizards according to Leviticus 20?
options: They shall be put to death by stoning
They shall be exiled for seven years
They shall offer a sin offering
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be put to death by stoning
questions.explanation: Leviticus 20:27 mandates death by stoning for those with familiar spirits or wizards, underscoring God’s intolerance of occult practices (cf. Deut 18:10-12; Exod 22:18; Gal 5:19-21; Acts 19:19).

questions.question: What does Leviticus 20 teach about the social consequences of disobedience to God's statutes?
options: Disobedience leads to being cut off or death among the people
Disobedience is only a private matter
questions.correctAnswer: Disobedience leads to being cut off or death among the people
questions.explanation: Throughout Leviticus 20 (e.g., vv. 3, 5, 6, 9, 17), disobedience to God's commands results in being cut off or put to death, reflecting God's holiness and covenant justice (cf. Num 15:30-31; Deut 29:19-20; Ezek 18:24; Heb 10:26-31).
